   much less likely. he may have stable coronary artery disease with

   present his case to the CT surgery i'd imagine he's perhaps not the

   secondary to a low output state due to his poor lv function vs genuine
   severe as is unclear at present. i think we have several priorities
   here. 1) optimize medical therapy for his cad and cardiac dysfunction.
   2) further evaluation of ongoing bloody stool and hematuria. 3) further
   evaluation of his coronary anatomy, coronary ischemia and severeity of
   AS.

   anticoagulate him at this point. Will continue home regimen of aspirin,

   - from his lv dysfunction point of view he appears fairly well
   compensated. will continue chf meds of ace-i, beta blocker and standing
   dose lasix.
